context_of_use: This use case allows admins to create, update, and manage products within the system.
stakeholders_and_interests: admin: Ensure products are available and pricing is accurate.
description: Enable admins to create products, update pricing, and maintain inventory levels.
preconditions: Admin is logged into the system.
Admin has the necessary permissions to manage products.
postconditions: Products are created, updated, or inventory levels are managed successfully.
assumptions: Admin has access to the product management interface.
The system has a functioning database for product information.
requirements_met: The system shall allow admins to create new products.
The system shall allow admins to update product prices.
The system shall allow admins to manage inventory levels.
outstanding_issues: Clarification on the approval process for new products.
main_flow: 1. Admin selects the option to manage products → System displays product management interface.
2. Admin chooses to create a new product → System prompts for product details.
3. Admin enters product details and submits → System saves the new product.
4. Admin chooses to update product prices → System displays current pricing information.
5. Admin updates the price and submits → System saves the updated price.
6. Admin chooses to manage inventory levels → System displays current inventory status.
7. Admin updates inventory levels and submits → System saves the updated inventory.
exception_flows: EF-1 (from Step 3): If product details are incomplete, System displays an error message and prompts for correction.
EF-2 (from Step 5): If the price update fails, System displays an error message indicating the failure.
